title: Standardize employee role classifications and access levels
description: Create a controlled vocabulary and data model for employee roles (e.g., pilot, maintenance engineer, dispatcher, ground handler, safety officer) and map each role to system access levels across HR, maintenance, flight ops, and safety systems. Deliverables: (1) role taxonomy document, (2) access matrix per system, (3) data dictionary entries for role-related attributes in the ontology.

title: Configure monitoring for new airline partnerships and codeshares
description: Set up automated monitoring to detect and log new airline partners and codeshare agreements. This includes: (1) defining data feeds or APIs from commercial/alliances systems, (2) creating rules to flag new IATA/ICAO codes and partnership types, and (3) writing to an airline master reference table with effective dates and partnership attributes for downstream planning and revenue systems.

title: Link aircraft entities to maintenance records and flight logs
description: Implement referential links between the AIRCRAFT master entity and all associated maintenance records and flight logs. This includes: (1) enforcing a unique aircraft identifier (e.g., tail number + operator or MSN) across systems, (2) updating ETL/ELT pipelines to populate foreign keys from maintenance and flight log tables to the aircraft master, and (3) validating linkage completeness for airworthiness tracking and reliability analysis.

title: Document aircraft type certifications and operational limits
description: Produce detailed documentation for aircraft type certifications (e.g., EASA/FAA type certificates) and operational limitations (MTOW, MLW, ETOPS limits, runway length requirements, altitude/temperature envelopes). Map these attributes into the AIRCRAFT ontology concept, including data sources, update frequency, and quality rules to support route planning, performance calculations, and compliance reporting.

title: Define passenger data retention and consent management standards
description: Document retention periods and lawful bases for each passenger data attribute (PNR data, contact details, payment info, special service requests, API/PNR data for border control) in line with GDPR and aviation-specific regulations. Specify how consent is captured, stored, and versioned, and define purge/anonymization rules to be implemented in data pipelines and analytical stores.

title: Document maintenance intervals by aircraft type and component
description: Create a structured catalog of maintenance intervals (flight hours, cycles, calendar time) for each aircraft type and major component (engines, landing gear, avionics, structural checks). Align with OEM maintenance planning documents (MPD) and regulatory requirements. Map these intervals into the MAINTENANCE ontology, including fields for threshold, tolerance, and last-completed references to support predictive maintenance and compliance audits.

title: Document baggage handling SLAs with ground handlers
description: Compile and standardize baggage handling SLAs per airport and ground handling partner, including maximum transfer times, delivery-to-belt targets, mishandled baggage thresholds, and escalation procedures. Map SLA attributes into the BAGGAGE ontology to enable automated monitoring of SLA adherence and integration with mishandled baggage KPIs.

title: Document delay compensation policies by regulation (EU261, DOT, etc.)
description: Create a structured reference of delay and cancellation compensation rules per jurisdiction (e.g., EU261, US DOT, local CAA rules), including thresholds, compensation amounts, exemptions, and required data evidence (delay cause, duration, notification times). Map these rules to the DELAY ontology to support automated eligibility checks and consistent customer handling.

title: Integrate HR systems with employee lifecycle in the ontology
description: Implement data integration between core HR systems and the EMPLOYEE ontology entity to capture full lifecycle events (hire, training, qualification, recurrent checks, role changes, leave, termination). Ensure that safety-critical roles (flight crew, maintenance, dispatch) have up-to-date status and qualification data available for rostering, maintenance sign-off, and audit reporting.

title: Implement airline master data management with IATA/ICAO validation
description: Create an authoritative AIRLINE master table with IATA and ICAO codes, legal names, alliances, and operational status. Integrate validation against official IATA/ICAO reference datasets and enforce code uniqueness and validity in upstream booking, scheduling, and operational systems. Implement change-data capture for airline mergers, rebrandings, and code changes.

title: Implement GDPR-compliant handling of passenger personal data
description: Operationalize GDPR and privacy controls for passenger data across booking, check-in, and post-flight systems. Implement: (1) data minimization rules in ingestion pipelines, (2) consent capture and revocation mechanisms, (3) subject access and erasure request workflows, and (4) encryption and masking for sensitive attributes in analytical environments, aligned with the PASSENGER ontology.

title: Monitor passenger satisfaction and complaint patterns
description: Design and implement monitoring for passenger satisfaction metrics (NPS, CSAT, post-flight surveys) and complaint categories (delays, baggage, service, safety concerns). Link these metrics to PASSENGER, FLIGHT, BAGGAGE, and DELAY entities to enable route-, aircraft-, and partner-level performance analysis. Configure dashboards and alerts for significant negative trends.

title: Integrate gate assignment with flight scheduling systems
description: Connect the GATE ontology entity with the flight scheduling and operations control systems to support dynamic gate assignment. Ensure that gate availability, aircraft type constraints, and turnaround requirements are reflected in real time. Implement APIs or data feeds that update gate assignments and statuses (occupied, cleaning, boarding, maintenance) for use in operations dashboards.

title: Monitor gate utilization and aircraft turnaround performance
description: Implement metrics and dashboards to track gate utilization (occupancy time, idle time) and turnaround durations by aircraft type, route, and airport. Link metrics to GATE, FLIGHT, and MAINTENANCE entities to identify bottlenecks (late cleaning, fueling, crew delays) and support optimization of gate planning and ground operations.

title: Ensure traceability from maintenance records to aircraft and technicians
description: Implement full traceability in the MAINTENANCE ontology by enforcing links from each maintenance event to the specific aircraft, component, and certified technician(s) who performed or signed off the work. Standardize technician identifiers, certification levels, and authorization scopes. Ensure that audit trails meet regulatory requirements for airworthiness and safety investigations.

title: Integrate baggage tracking systems (RFID/barcode) for real-time visibility
description: Connect RFID and barcode-based baggage tracking systems with the BAGGAGE ontology entity to provide end-to-end visibility from check-in to loading, transfer, and delivery. Standardize baggage tag identifiers, event types (loaded, offloaded, transferred, delivered), and timestamps. Expose real-time status to customer-facing channels and operations dashboards.

title: Monitor mishandled baggage rates by flight and route
description: Set up monitoring to calculate mishandled baggage KPIs (lost, delayed, damaged) per flight, route, airport, and ground handler. Link events from baggage tracking and customer complaint systems to the BAGGAGE and FLIGHT entities. Configure alerts when SLA thresholds defined in baggage handling agreements are breached.

title: Implement standardized IATA delay code classification
description: Enforce the use of IATA delay codes across operational and reporting systems by mapping all delay causes to the standardized IATA taxonomy. Update data capture interfaces and ETL logic to store both raw reason text and normalized delay code in the DELAY ontology. Validate code usage and completeness to support regulatory reporting and compensation decisions.

title: Develop delay analytics dashboards for trend analysis
description: Build analytics dashboards that visualize delay patterns by route, aircraft type, airport, airline partner, and IATA delay code. Integrate data from the DELAY ontology with weather, ATC restrictions, and maintenance events to identify systemic issues. Include drill-down capabilities for operations and network planning teams to prioritize mitigation actions.

title: Implement real-time aircraft status monitoring dashboard
description: Create a real-time dashboard that consolidates aircraft status (in-flight, on-ground, in-maintenance, AOG, standby) from flight operations, maintenance, and telemetry systems. Link status to the AIRCRAFT ontology entity and include key indicators such as next scheduled maintenance, open defects, and recent technical events to support operations control and fleet management decisions.
